title: Decleration vs Assignment vs Initilization
description:
This is somthing that beginners commonly mix up. Decleration is creating a new empty variable, eg int hunger;, Assignment is setting/changing the value of an existing variable, eg pancakes = 3;. Notice that there was no type in that statment, that is because that was assignment. Assignment ASSIGNS a value to an existing variable. Initilization is creatign a variable with a value already in it. This is what you do most of the time, eg char pound = '#';. 

 Your task is to declare a variable char x, and initilize a variable y with value 7.
